snippet: It is the eighth consecutive quarter in which the company’s revenue has slipped, with this quarter hit hard by a falloff in its hardware business.
abstract: IBM reports in its 2014 first-quarter results that its net income fell 21 percent to $2.4 billion, compared with $3 billion a year earlier; revenue declined to $22.5 billion, compared with $23.4 billion in year-earlier quarter; operating earnings per share fell 15 percent, to $2.54 a share, from $3 a share in 2013.
lead_paragraph: It is the eighth consecutive quarter in which the company’s revenue has slipped, with this quarter hit hard by a falloff in its hardware business.

headline.main: Profit and Revenue Slip at IBM as Hardware Sales Fall and Layoff Costs Rise
headline.print_headline: Profit and Revenue Slip at IBM as Hardware Sales Fall and Layoff Costs Rise
